basics.name: Madison Cranmer
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Born and raised in Alaska, Madison now goes to school at Eastern Washington University. In June 2019 she will graduate with a Bachelor of Arts in Visual Communications Design, UX Certificate. and a minor in Communication Studies. Madi is passionate in being creative and thinking outside the box. Well versed in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and User Experience Design.

work.summary: Housing and Residential Life at EWU strives to make living on-campus an excellent experience by building community, personal development, and striving in academics.
highlights: Create flyers, bulletin boards, and programs that are engaging and education
Keep contact with supervisor, co-workers, and residents everyday

work.summary: BAC Transportation strives to create a reliable transportation service to people traveling in Alaska. Timeliness and professionalism is essential while working for BAC
highlights: Friendly customer service through the phone and email on a daily basis
Multi-tasking between phone calls, emails, and customers coming to reservations

volunteer.organization: Various Projects in Cheney and Spokane
volunteer.summary: Through EWU and the Community Adviser position, Madi has participated and facilitated multiple projects in the Spokane and Cheney area
highlights: Raised over $300 and created toys and blankets for Spokane Humane Society
Participated in community service on Martin Luther King Jr. Day of Service at the House of Charity, SCRAPS, and cleaned homes
Facilitated Penny and Can Wars for Feed Cheney
Spent time raising money and donating time for Vanessa Behan Crisis Nursery

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Every quarter at EWU since Madison started, she has been on the Dean's List, which is awarded for having a 3.5 GPA or higher

awards.title: Bronze Pin
awards.awarder: Eastern Washington University Housing and Residential Life
awards.summary: Awarded a bronze pin for exceding in leadership as a Community Advisory, Publicity Adviser in the National Residence Hall Honorary, and attending a National Leadership Conference where my program was top 50 out of the country.

awards.title: Induction into a National Society
awards.summary: Was inducted into the National Society of Collegiate Scholars due to excellent grades
